definition: thick pole/bar/rod/thick line/to mark with a thick line/to sharpen (knife)/(old) coffin-bearing pole

sentences.english: She gripped the bars tightly during her acrobatic routine.
sentences.chinese: 她做规定动作时紧紧抓住了双杠。

sentences.english: Celia was the first to go on the parallel bars.
With such strength training can be supported on the parallel bars .
sentences.chinese: 等有了力量可以在双杠上练支撑。

sentences.english: Mr. Lange lifted me up to the parallel bars.
sentences.chinese: 兰格先生将我送上双杠。

sentences.english: He invented several pieces of equipment including the parallel bars, the horizontal bar and the rings.
sentences.chinese: 他发明了一些体操器械，包括双杠单杠和吊环。

sentences.english: On the pavement outside, there are a handful of basketball hoops and a set of rusty metal parallel bars.
sentences.chinese: 教室外面的操场竖着几个篮球架和生锈的金属双杠。

sentences.english: Her hands blindly groped for the bars as she came back down.
sentences.chinese: 她下来的时候，两手盲目地摸索双杠。

sentences.english: What is the key element in a parallel bars routine?
sentences.chinese: 双杠成套动作的关键成分是什么？

sentences.english: The gymnast swung on the parallel bars.
sentences.chinese: 体操运动员在双杠上摆动身子。

sentences.english: Only men perform on the rings, on the double bars, on the high bar.
sentences.chinese: 只有男人才能表演吊环，双杠，高杠。
